intro: Osbeckia antherotoma, commonly known as the narrowleaf osbeckia, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to greenish flowers, which are typically arranged in racemes. Osbeckia antherotoma is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its native range.
